alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 21 at 11:32PM CDT until September 22 at 5:30AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Phillips County in north central Kansas... Western Smith County in north central Kansas... * Until 530 AM CDT. * At 1132 PM CDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in the warned area with numerous county roads under water. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Phillipsburg, Logan, Kensington, Agra, Kirwin, Long Island, Prairie View, Glade, Athol, Speed, Cedar and Woodruff. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
